subtitle:

title: TheGalleryDMU
subtitle:
Since October 2015, @gilesduley has documented the experiences of refugees for @refugees (UNHCR) after already spotlighting the families affected in his work for years. He will be joining us tomorrow evening for a free artist talk. 
https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/giles-duley-artist-talk-journeys-festival-international-leicester-2019-tickets-63476578154?ref=estw&fbclid=IwAR1qkWOKhjMZpL0dDWmjuiCLpSLhFzvCBE8BFMA1mvSwzfxDu1b2um-XSaA …pic.twitter.com/sXJfshgSh5

title: Nila Tanzil
subtitle: Happy to be sharing the story of my latest book "Epi's New Friend" at the writing workshop for these talented group of young writers at @Mini_Stories in London! They have to write poems on refugees inspired by the story afterwards . | #ImagineNationpic.twitter.com/jJinLADGun

title: JRS International
subtitle: In 2018, JRS reached over 677,000 refugees around the world. We made a video to show you our work. Watch it here: https://youtu.be/rFHNUWX-0Hc pic.twitter.com/z6RU8fp4SV

title: Esther Shaylor
subtitle: As a refugee from Syria relocated to Jordan in temporary accomodation, with only your mother and no news on your father or brothers status, you start your period. What do you need to support you? Important discussions at #WWWeekpic.twitter.com/hZuRMUpZc9

title: UNESCO WWAP
subtitle:
Kholoud Al-Aljarma was born and raised in a refugee camp in Palestine. She shows how 'eco-camps' can clearly help to improve the living conditions of #refugees.
#WWWeek #WWWmigrationpic.twitter.com/lyc8LuKV27

title: Fr. Grant Ciccone ☩
subtitle: I cannot stop thinking about this heart-wrenching image created by the Turkish artist ugurgallen who merged the image of a Rohingya refugee mother & her child fleeing to Bangladesh with an icon of The Holy Family to call to mind their perilous flight into Egypt centuries ago. pic.twitter.com/OIgKJsVkme

title: Sunday Assembly RDG
subtitle: As the music fades and the parties disperse we’re gearing up for a hot festival clear up tomorrow. Salvaging tents and clothes for refugee charities. It’s dirty but it’s always good to work alongside brilliant charities doing essential work for people in need. #rdguk #togetherpic.twitter.com/Tl8Mk1VreG

title: Siddig Feana
subtitle:
According to UN records, Darfur refugees are estimated to be around five million displaced persons and refugees, as well as IDPs, refugees and displaced people in dam areas in the north.
Considering the suffering, frustration and negative discharge in the displacement and asylum pic.twitter.com/l9ooqxqfVt

title: John Scott
subtitle: Free installation/performance today @VisualCarlow 3pm with Refugees from Rohingya community and African community - Migration Sonata part 1 pic.twitter.com/ub4gvZqA2Z

title: Leanne M.
subtitle: Spent another summer teaching English to Palestinian/ Syrian refugees in Lebanon. After being with the kids 24/7 & since I’ve come back to London, I’ve brought back countless stories, lessons and memories, but I certainly feel that I’ve left a piece of my heart back with them.  pic.twitter.com/ZsBU6L9WfD

title: The Photographers’ Gallery
subtitle:
#TPGNewTalent artist, Alice Myers is taking over the TPG Instagram this weekend - including stories and images from her project 'Nothing is Impossible Under the Sun' gathered while working with refugees and migrants in Calais.

Follow along here: https://www.instagram.com/thephotographersgallery/ …pic.twitter.com/VLEnO05pqy
